intro: Zingiber engganoense, commonly known as Enggano ginger, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the island of Enggano in Indonesia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes other economically important plants like ginger and turmeric. The plant features a rhizomatous root system and produces striking, lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive reddish hue. Its flowers are typically yellow with red veins and are arranged in inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Zingiber engganoense is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
